lines.text:
[to Anita]
You see, I come from a small town. We don't have any of those fine hotels. We eat at the drugstore... But we leave a tip just the same.
No. No, Shaughnessy was a jockey from Caliente. Five foot three. Once over the border, I went to a judge. I said, a woman wants a man, not a radiator cap! Divorce granted, fifty dollars.
All those years with all the others, I've shut my eyes and thought of you.
I'll be the doggonedest dog to end all doggoned dogs! Maybe I'm just dumb.

[having just let Anita know that he prefers the company of Emmy]
You've got enough money to get you back to New York. I'll find you there when I'm ready.
Thanks! You just stand right in the middle of Times Square ... and whistle!

[to Emmy]
You needn't be afraid, Miss Brown. Not a bit. You see, we are like ... two trains, halted for a moment at the same station. But we're going in different directions. We can't change our course, any more than we can hold back the dawn.
I'm like a cucumber in an icebox... feel my cheek.
If you carry a torch long enough, it burns out... my hands are scorched.
